sect2.title: Opening files and directories
sect2.para: Start WinMerge and select "Open" from File-menu, from toolbar or press Ctrl-O. File/directory selection dialog is shown:
The Open dialog has two fields that are used to specify files/directories to compare. Comparison objects can be specified in one of four ways:

listitem.para: Enter the path names directly into the edit fields
Click the Browse button and use the file chooser to navigate to the desired object
Expand the combo box and select a previously entered path (WinMerge remembers the last 20)
Drag & drop something into the edit field from Explorer

sect2.para: Directory can be selected from Windows Open dialog (opens when "Browse"-button is selected) by browsing into directory to open and selecting "Open"-button. It does not require selecting a file.

There can be only file & file or directory & directory to open for compare. If there is file & directory or other one of files/directories cannot be found WinMerge disables "OK"-button in dialog. Set of files to compare can be restricted by typing filename extensions wanted to compare into "Extensions"-field. Multiple extensions can be given by separating extensions with semicolon. For example: *.cpp;*.hpp;*.c;*.h. There is very powerful way to specify set of files and directories using file filters.
"Recursive" -checkbox controls if subdirectories of selected directories are included in compare results.
Rest of controls in this dialog are for plugins.
